Dan, 

I have posted a new Windows binary version of the MATLAB interface. 
It is in file cantera-1.3-r2-mlab.zip in directory 1.3/win32 
under 'download' on the Cantera site.

Note that this version contains some minor fixes, but doesn't add 
many new capabilities beyond the previous MATLAB toolbox. In 
particular, it doesn't yet support 1D flames, which the Python 
interface now does.

Dave



--- In cantera@y..., "flowerscantera1" <flowers4@l...> wrote:
> I have been using the previous matlab interface for cantera and 
found 
> it very easy to setup and use.  I did encounter problems reading 
some 
> mechanisms files, and comments in the newsgroup suggested that 
these 
> may now be fixed in the latest version. 
> 
> Thus, I am now trying to build the matlab interface in windows 
using 
> version 1.3.  It appears to require ct.lib in the "cantera-1.3
\lib\" 
> directory (I get this from looking at buildwin.m).   I believe I 
need 
> to build this library using the visual c++ compiler.  If this is 
> correct, and since I do not have the visual c++ compiler, would it 
be 
> possible to provide the ct.lib file? Are there any other libraries 
> required to build the matlab interface?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Dan Flowers
> LLNL
